Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two different habitats, such as one on land (like a playground or forest) and one in water (like a pond or stream).
The student can include in their drawings various living things found in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, or animals like fish or lizards.
The student can use their drawings to show how different plants and animals live in different habitats.
The student can identify patterns by comparing the types of living things in each habitat, highlighting the variety or diversity of life.
The student can show observations of plant and animal diversity, indicating where they exist within each habitat.
